title: Ossuary
data:
***Version [0.29](/0.29 "0.29")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| - | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | The ossuary is a small tomb containing the remains and grave goods of some distant relatives of the pharaohs, along with the corpses of their retainers and household animals. It is undoubtedly riddled with many traps, and its undead denizens are unlikely to take kindly to looting. |

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| - | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | You can make out a staircase leading downwards into a small tomb. Sand surrounds the staircase and is continuously pouring onto it. Before long the staircase will be gone. They say that some distant relatives of the pharaohs were entombed here. |

[![Ossuary portal.png](/images/a/a3/Ossuary_portal.png)](/File:Ossuary_portal.png)[Ossuary]() is a temporary [portal](/Portal "Portal") level found in the early Dungeon. Ossuraries are filled with [undead](/Undead "Undead") monsters, including [mummies](/Mummy_\(monster\) "Mummy (monster)"), often contain [traps](/Trap "Trap"), and have a pile of treasure at the end.

Ossuaries may appear on [Dungeon](/Dungeon "Dungeon"): 4-8. The portal is signaled by a "hiss of flowing sand"; if you take too long, the entrance closes. Ossurary entrances usually have yellow walls around them.

## Contents

- [1 Layout](#Layout)
- [2 Monsters](#Monsters)
- [3 Tips & Tricks](#Tips_.26_Tricks)
- [4 History](#History)

## Layout

The Ossuary's layout is unpredictable. Although it's always a fairly small floor, it ranges from a wide open crypt with little cover, to a series of interconnected rooms, all separated by doors.

## Monsters

Most ossuary layouts house the usual undead:

|                                                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                         |                                                                                                                                                 |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Z [![Small zombie.png](/images/7/7a/Small_zombie.png)](/File:Small_zombie.png) **[Zombie](/Zombie "Zombie")** | Z [![Skeleton medium humanoid.png](/images/6/69/Skeleton_medium_humanoid.png)](/File:Skeleton_medium_humanoid.png) **[Skeleton](/Skeleton "Skeleton")** | M [![Mummy (monster).png](/images/8/8b/Mummy_%28monster%29.png)](/File:Mummy_\(monster\).png) **[Mummy](/Mummy_\(monster\) "Mummy (monster)")** |

Other monsters only appear in specific layouts and are usually more dangerous:

z [![Wight.png](/images/e/ec/Wight.png)](/File:Wight.png) **[Wight](/Wight "Wight")** - Have normal speed, enchanted weapons and are capable of draining you.

W [![Wraith.png](/images/7/7c/Wraith.png)](/File:Wraith.png) **[Wraith](/Wraith "Wraith")** - Very strong for an Ossurary, and capable of [slowing](/Slow "Slow") you down from melee attacks. Many layouts with them start with some wraiths locked behind transparent [walls](/Wall "Wall").

Z[![Simulacrum small humanoid.png](/images/9/9a/Simulacrum_small_humanoid.png)](/File:Simulacrum_small_humanoid.png)**[Simulacrum](/Simulacrum_\(monster\) "Simulacrum (monster)")** - Fragile icy constructs that deal extra cold damage.

Z[![Spectral small humanoid.png](/images/8/8a/Spectral_small_humanoid.png)](/File:Spectral_small_humanoid.png)**[Spectral thing](/Spectral_thing "Spectral thing")** - Slow and weak but intelligent spirits that can regenerate and have draining attacks

s [![Scorpion.png](/images/a/ab/Scorpion.png)](/File:Scorpion.png) **[Scorpion](/Scorpion "Scorpion")** - The only living monster encountered in ossuaries. Can inflict [poisoning](/Poison "Poison").

M [![Menkaure.png](/images/9/9d/Menkaure.png)](/File:Menkaure.png) **[Menkaure](/Menkaure "Menkaure")** - A unique mummy, capable of [torment](/Torment "Torment"). Fragile, but extremely dangerous.

z [![Flying skull.png](/images/3/39/Flying_skull.png)](/File:Flying_skull.png) **[Flying skull](/Flying_skull "Flying skull")** - Fast and dangerous at this point of the dungeon. Will wake up everything with their shrieking.

M [![Mummy.png](/images/7/70/Mummy.png)](/File:Mummy.png) **Bog mummy** - A [mummy](/Mummy_\(monster\)#Variant_Mummy "Mummy (monster)") that can cast [Throw Frost](/Throw_Frost "Throw Frost") and [Slow](/Slow "Slow"). Can be found in a partially submerged ossuary level.

For the various [derived undead](/Derived_undead "Derived undead") you'll encounter, the base types will be monsters that tend to be seen in the upper dungeon, ranging from [goblins](/Goblin "Goblin") and [kobolds](/Kobold "Kobold") through [elves](/Elf "Elf") and [humans](/Human_\(monster\) "Human (monster)") up to around [water moccasins](/Water_moccasin "Water moccasin").

## Tips & Tricks

- The Ossuary is often found very early in the game. [Ice Elementalists](/Ice_Elementalist "Ice Elementalist"), [Venom Mages](/Venom_Mage "Venom Mage") and [Necromancers](/Necromancer "Necromancer") without [Dispel Undead](/Dispel_Undead "Dispel Undead") may want to skip it if they have no means of dealing with undead enemies.
- The mummies you encounter are slow, but hit hard. Fire [damage](/Damage "Damage") or weapons of [holy wrath](/Holy_wrath "Holy wrath") will make short work of them.
- Even average speed species are faster than mummies and zombies, so are able to disengage if things get sour. Fast species like [spriggans](/Spriggan "Spriggan") can handle many layouts without a single fight.

## History

- Prior to [0.19](/0.19 "0.19"), players could find a decayed [bog body](/Bog_body "Bog body") instead of a [bog mummy](/Mummy_\(monster\)#Variant_Mummy "Mummy (monster)") in a flooded ossuary. It was weaker than its [swamp](/Swamp "Swamp")-dwelling brethren and had [Throw Frost](/Throw_Frost "Throw Frost") instead of [Bolt of Cold](/Bolt_of_Cold "Bolt of Cold").
- Ossuary was added in [0.5.0](/0.5.0 "0.5.0") and was first called "Minitomb".

|            | Temporary [Portals](/Portals "Portals")                                                                                                                                                            |
| ---------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Early Game | [Ossuary]() • [Sewers](/Sewers "Sewers")                                                                                                                                                           |
| Mid Game   | [Bailey](/Bailey "Bailey") • [Gauntlet](/Gauntlet "Gauntlet") • [Ice cave](/Ice_cave "Ice cave") • [Volcano](/Volcano "Volcano")                                                                   |
| Late Game  | [Desolation of Salt](/Desolation_of_Salt "Desolation of Salt") • [Wizard Laboratory](/Wizard_Laboratory "Wizard Laboratory") • [Ziggurat](/Ziggurat "Ziggurat") ([Mega-Zig](/Mega-Zig "Mega-Zig")) |
| Peaceful   | [Bazaar](/Bazaar "Bazaar") • [Treasure trove](/Treasure_trove "Treasure trove")                                                                                                                    |
html:
Ossuary

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.29: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
The ossuary is a small tomb containing the remains and grave goods of some distant relatives of the pharaohs, along with the corpses of their retainers and household animals. It is undoubtedly riddled with many traps, and its undead denizens are unlikely to take kindly to looting.
You can make out a staircase leading downwards into a small tomb. Sand surrounds the staircase and is continuously pouring onto it. Before long the staircase will be gone. They say that some distant relatives of the pharaohs were entombed here.

Ossuary is a temporary portal level found in the early Dungeon. Ossuraries are filled with undead monsters, including mummies, often contain traps, and have a pile of treasure at the end.

Ossuaries may appear on Dungeon: 4-8. The portal is signaled by a "hiss of flowing sand"; if you take too long, the entrance closes. Ossurary entrances usually have yellow walls around them.

Contents

  • 1 Layout
  • 2 Monsters
  • 3 Tips & Tricks
  • 4 History

Layout

The Ossuary's layout is unpredictable. Although it's always a fairly small floor, it ranges from a wide open crypt with little cover, to a series of interconnected rooms, all separated by doors.

Monsters

Most ossuary layouts house the usual undead:

Z Zombie Z Skeleton M Mummy

Other monsters only appear in specific layouts and are usually more dangerous:

z Wight - Have normal speed, enchanted weapons and are capable of draining you.

W Wraith - Very strong for an Ossurary, and capable of slowing you down from melee attacks. Many layouts with them start with some wraiths locked behind transparent walls.

ZSimulacrum - Fragile icy constructs that deal extra cold damage.

ZSpectral thing - Slow and weak but intelligent spirits that can regenerate and have draining attacks

s Scorpion - The only living monster encountered in ossuaries. Can inflict poisoning.

M Menkaure - A unique mummy, capable of torment. Fragile, but extremely dangerous.

z Flying skull - Fast and dangerous at this point of the dungeon. Will wake up everything with their shrieking.

M Bog mummy - A mummy that can cast Throw Frost and Slow. Can be found in a partially submerged ossuary level.

For the various derived undead you'll encounter, the base types will be monsters that tend to be seen in the upper dungeon, ranging from goblins and kobolds through elves and humans up to around water moccasins.

Tips & Tricks

  • The Ossuary is often found very early in the game. Ice Elementalists, Venom Mages and Necromancers without Dispel Undead may want to skip it if they have no means of dealing with undead enemies.
  • The mummies you encounter are slow, but hit hard. Fire damage or weapons of holy wrath will make short work of them.
  • Even average speed species are faster than mummies and zombies, so are able to disengage if things get sour. Fast species like spriggans can handle many layouts without a single fight.

History

  • Prior to 0.19, players could find a decayed bog body instead of a bog mummy in a flooded ossuary. It was weaker than its swamp-dwelling brethren and had Throw Frost instead of Bolt of Cold.
  • Ossuary was added in 0.5.0 and was first called "Minitomb".
Temporary Portals
Early Game Ossuary • Sewers
Mid Game Bailey • Gauntlet • Ice cave • Volcano
Late Game Desolation of Salt • Wizard Laboratory • Ziggurat (Mega-Zig)
Peaceful Bazaar • Treasure trove
Retrieved from "http://crawl.chaosforge.org/index.php?title=Ossuary&oldid=74181"

{{version029}}
{{flavour|The ossuary is a small tomb containing the remains and grave goods of some distant relatives of the pharaohs, along with the corpses of their retainers and household animals. It is undoubtedly riddled with many traps, and its undead denizens are unlikely to take kindly to looting.}}

{{Flavour|You can make out a staircase leading downwards into a small tomb. Sand surrounds the staircase and is continuously pouring onto it. Before long the staircase will be gone. They say that some distant relatives of the pharaohs were entombed here.}}

[[File:Ossuary portal.png]][[Ossuary]] is a temporary [[portal]] level found in the early Dungeon. Ossuraries are filled with [[undead]] monsters, including [[mummy (monster)|mummies]], often contain [[trap]]s, and have a pile of treasure at the end.

Ossuaries may appear on [[Dungeon]]: 4-8. The portal is signaled by a "hiss of flowing sand"; if you take too long, the entrance closes. Ossurary entrances usually have yellow walls around them.

==Layout==
The Ossuary's layout is unpredictable. Although it's always a fairly small floor, it ranges from a wide open crypt with little cover, to a series of interconnected rooms, all separated by doors.

==Monsters==
Most ossuary layouts house the usual undead:
{| class="prettytable" style="border:none; margin:0; padding:0;"
|-
| {{Brown|Z}} [[File:Small_zombie.png]] '''[[Zombie]]''' || {{LightGrey|Z}} [[File:Skeleton_medium_humanoid.png]] '''[[Skeleton]]''' || {{LightGrey|M}} [[File:Mummy_(monster).png]] '''[[Mummy_(monster)|Mummy]]''' 
|}

Other monsters only appear in specific layouts and are usually more dangerous:

{{monsterlink|Wight}} - Have normal speed, enchanted weapons and are capable of draining you.

{{monsterlink|Wraith}} - Very strong for an Ossurary, and capable of [[slow]]ing you down from melee attacks. Many layouts with them start with some wraiths locked behind transparent [[wall]]s.

{{Blue|Z}}[[File:Simulacrum small humanoid.png]]'''[[Simulacrum (monster)|Simulacrum]]''' - Fragile icy constructs that deal extra cold damage.

{{Green|Z}}[[File:Spectral small humanoid.png]]'''[[Spectral thing]]''' - Slow and weak but intelligent spirits that can regenerate and have draining attacks

{{monsterlink|Scorpion}} - The only living monster encountered in ossuaries. Can inflict [[poison]]ing.

{{monsterlink|Menkaure}} - A unique mummy, capable of [[torment]]. Fragile, but extremely dangerous.

{{monsterlink|Flying skull}} - Fast and dangerous at this point of the dungeon. Will wake up everything with their shrieking.

{{Green|M}} [[File:Mummy.png]] '''Bog mummy''' - A [[mummy (monster)#Variant Mummy|mummy]] that can cast [[Throw Frost]] and [[Slow]]. Can be found in a partially submerged ossuary level.

For the various [[derived undead]] you'll encounter, the base types will be monsters that tend to be seen in the upper dungeon, ranging from [[goblin]]s and [[kobold]]s through [[elf|elves]] and [[human (monster)|humans]] up to around [[water moccasin]]s.

==Tips & Tricks==
*The Ossuary is often found very early in the game. [[Ice Elementalist]]s, [[Venom Mage]]s and [[Necromancer]]s without [[Dispel Undead]] may want to skip it if they have no means of dealing with undead enemies.
*The mummies you encounter are slow, but hit hard. Fire [[damage]] or weapons of [[holy wrath]] will make short work of them.
*Even average speed species are faster than mummies and zombies, so are able to disengage if things get sour. Fast species like [[spriggan]]s can handle many layouts without a single fight.

==History==
*Prior to [[0.19]], players could find a decayed [[bog body]] instead of a [[mummy (monster)#Variant Mummy|bog mummy]] in a flooded ossuary. It was weaker than its [[swamp]]-dwelling brethren and had [[Throw Frost]] instead of [[Bolt of Cold]].
*Ossuary was added in [[0.5.0]] and was first called "Minitomb".
